headline.main: Many Americans Struggle to Pay for Health Care, Survey Finds

docs.abstract: Half of those with health insurance say they have skipped or delayed care due to high costs.
docs.snippet: Half of those with health insurance say they have skipped or delayed care due to high costs.

headline.main: This Week in Small Business: Working Without Pay

docs.abstract: Plus: the week’s best tweets, how to get rid of your bookkeeper, how to rob a bank, and why you should give yourself a doughnut.
docs.snippet: Plus: the week’s best tweets, how to get rid of your bookkeeper, how to rob a bank, and why you should give yourself a doughnut.

docs.lead_paragraph: The American public will find out if its political leaders are up the dual task of preserving the recovery and putting the budget on a sustainable long-term path.
docs.abstract: Editorial identifies several key areas of the upcoming debate over the tax increases and spending cuts slated to take effect in 2013; contends that the way in which political leaders address these issues will allow Americans to see whether they are up to the dual task of preserving the recovery and putting the budget on a sustainable long-term path.
docs.snippet: The American public will find out if its political leaders are up the dual task of preserving the recovery and putting the budget on a sustainable long-term path.

docs.lead_paragraph: Three years after saying he would not buy a newspaper at any price, Warren Buffett has moved aggressively into the business, buying 63 papers and taking a 3 percent stake in Lee Enterprises.

headline.seo: Newspaper Work, With Buffett as the Boss
headline.main: Newspaper Work, With Warren Buffett as Boss
headline.print_headline: Newspaper Work, With Buffett as Boss

docs.abstract: Warren E Buffett, three years after telling his shareholders he would not buy a newspaper at any price, has moved aggressively into the business, buying 63 papers and taking a 3 percent stake in Lee Enterprises; he has owned The Buffalo News in Buffalo, NY, since 1977; while he is less certain how he will make papers profitable in the digital age, he is confident that in certain cities, newspapers will thrive.
docs.snippet: Three years after saying he would not buy a newspaper at any price, Warren Buffett has moved aggressively into the business, buying 63 papers and taking a 3 percent stake in Lee Enterprises.

docs.lead_paragraph: Not even medically fragile, technology dependent people are safe from the vicious, man-eating Reformasaurus in Illinois.

headline.main: Will the Reformers Come for Me, Too?
headline.print_headline: Will the Reformers Come for Me, Too?

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by disability rights activist Mike Ervin expresses his concern at the zeal with which state and federal officials are slashing Medicaid funding, as they have done in his home state of Illinois; outlines the cost and the extent of the help he receives from Medicaid for his disability and contends that if funding is cut, it would cost more to institutionalize him.
docs.snippet: Not even medically fragile, technology dependent people are safe from the vicious, man-eating Reformasaurus in Illinois.

headline.main: Life After the Health Care Ruling

docs.abstract: What would the future hold if the Supreme Court strikes down the most controversial part of the health care law, the individual mandate?
docs.snippet: What would the future hold if the Supreme Court strikes down the most controversial part of the health care law, the individual mandate?

docs.lead_paragraph: A company with deep ties to Gov. Chris Christie dominates New Jersey’s system of large halfway houses. There has been little state oversight, despite widespread problems.

headline.seo: In New Jersey Halfway Houses, Escapees Stream Out as a Penal Business Thrives
headline.main: As Escapees Stream Out, a Penal Business Thrives
headline.print_headline: As Escapees Stream Out, A Penal Business Thrives

docs.abstract: New Jersey, grappling with crowded prisons, has become a leader in a national movement to save money by diverting inmates to a new kind of privately run halfway house; halfway houses have mutated into a shadow corrections network, where drugs, gang activity and violence often go unchecked; system is largely administered by Community Education Centers, company that has deep connections to politicians of both parties, including Gov Chris Christie (Series: Unlocked).
docs.snippet: A company with deep ties to Gov. Chris Christie dominates New Jersey’s system of large halfway houses. There has been little state oversight, despite widespread problems.

byline.contributor: Jo Craven McGinty, Sheelagh McNeill and Jack Styczynski contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Chukchansi Indians recently pledged $1 million over five years to the linguistics department of California State University, Fresno.

headline.seo: Chukchansi Tribe in California Pushes to Preserve Language
headline.main: With Casino Revenues, Tribes Push to Preserve Languages, and Cultures
headline.print_headline: With Casino Revenues, Tribes Push to Preserve Languages, and Cultures

docs.abstract: Chukchansi Indians, using revenues from their casino in Coarsegold, Calif, have pledged $1 million over five years to the linguistics department of California State University, Fresno to help preserve their unwritten language; donation caps efforts by American Indian tribes across the nation to bring back their tongues before the death of their sole surviving speakers.
docs.snippet: The Chukchansi Indians recently pledged $1 million over five years to the linguistics department of California State University, Fresno.
